html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • abligūriō

Etymology[edit]

From ab- (“from, away from”) +‎ ligūriō (“lick; be dainty, fond of good things”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ab.liˈɡur.ri.oː/, [ab.lʲɪˈɡʊr.ri.oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ab.liˈɡur.ri.o/, [ab.liˈɡur.ri.ɔ]

Verb[edit]

abligurriō (present infinitive abligurrīre, perfect active abligurrīvī or abligurriī, supine abligurrītum); fourth conjugation

  1. (transitive) I lick away, waste or spend indulgently; squander.
